summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The Government is responding to defense counsel's letter and requests a limited unsealing of the Court's August 13, 2021 opinion and underlying motion papers to review and propose redactions, as the Government does not have copies and believes the papers may contain names of victims and potential witnesses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, to whom this letter is addressed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who submitted this letter on behalf of the Government.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is representing the Government prosecuting Maxwell.

events.title: Court Denies Defense Subpoena Motion
events.description: The Court issued a sealed opinion denying defense counsel's ex parte motion for an order authorizing four Rule 17(c)(3) subpoenas.

events.title: Defense Counsel's Letter
events.description: Defense counsel submitted a letter to the Court regarding sealing/redactions of the August 13 opinion and motion papers.

events.title: Government's Response Letter
events.description: The Government filed this letter in response to defense counsel's August 19 letter, requesting limited unsealing of documents.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
The Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The Government does not have a copy of the sealed motion papers or the Court's August 13, 2021 Opinion and Order denying defense subpoenas.
The Government believes the sealed motion papers include names of victims and potential witnesses, which they would likely move to redact.
Defense counsel informed the Government they cannot provide a copy of the sealed documents without a further court order.
The Government is requesting a limited unsealing of the Court's opinion and underlying motion papers solely to review them and propose redactions.
